Steps.StepString: Given a simple Web server written in Python, handling only GET and POST requests with files

Substeps.SubstepString: Have knowledge of a simple Web server written in Python
The Web server handles only GET and POST requests with files

Steps.StepString: Developed a suspicion of a directory traversal vulnerability either in the GET path handling or the POST filename

Substeps.SubstepString: Developed a suspicion of a directory traversal vulnerability
The suspicion is related to either the GET path handling or the POST filename

Steps.StepString: Added debug prints to the file for the GET path and POST filename to confirm the suspected vulnerability

Substeps.SubstepString: Added debug prints to the file for the GET path
Added debug prints to the file for the POST filename
The purpose of adding debug prints is to confirm the suspected vulnerability

Steps.StepString: Confirmed that there was a directory traversal vulnerability in the POST filename

Substeps.SubstepString: Confirmed the existence of a directory traversal vulnerability
The vulnerability is present in the POST filename

Steps.StepString: Used the discovered vulnerability to write a request to the root directory with the filename 'lol.txt' and the content 'HACKED'

Substeps.SubstepString: Exploited the discovered vulnerability
Wrote a request to the root directory
The filename used in the request was 'lol.txt'
The content written in the request was 'HACKED'

Steps.StepString: Looked for files that could be overwritten, but couldn't modify anything in '/home/manhndd/.ssh/' due to a lack of appropriate permission

Substeps.SubstepString: Explored files that could be overwritten
Cannot modify anything in '/home/manhndd/.ssh/'
The reason for inability to modify is due to a lack of appropriate permission

Steps.StepString: Decided to overwrite '.bashrc' file, which would execute when the user 'manhndd' SSH-es into the server

Substeps.SubstepString: Made the decision to overwrite '.bashrc' file
The execution of '.bashrc' occurs when the user 'manhndd' SSH-es into the server

Steps.StepString: Race with other players in the game to overwrite '.bashrc' file with their payload

Substeps.SubstepString: Engaged in a race with other players
The objective is to overwrite '.bashrc' file with their payload

Steps.StepString: Due to the absence of 'nc' and any way to exfiltrate the flag, read the flag from '/var/secret' and write it to '/opt/mydank', wherein '/opt' is the web facing directory

Substeps.SubstepString: The absence of 'nc' and any exfiltration method restricts the options
Read the flag from '/var/secret'
Write the flag to '/opt/mydank'
'/opt' is the web facing directory

Steps.StepString: Spammed 'Go' on Burp's repeater to send the request and concurrently wrote a Python script to read from '/mydank'

Substeps.SubstepString: Performed repetitive actions of sending requests
Used Burp's repeater to spam 'Go'
Simultaneously wrote a Python script
The script reads from '/mydank'

Steps.StepString: Finally, managed to win the race and acquire the flag

Substeps.SubstepString: Successfully won the race
Acquired the flag
